wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-General Sir Richard Phillip Bradshaw, KBE (1 August 1920 – 12 October 1999) was a senior British Army officer and doctor. He served as Director General Army Medical Services from 1977 to 1981.

response: * Lt-Gen Sir Richard Bradshaw, Director General from 1977 to 1981 of the Army Medical Services, and Commandant from 1973 to 1975 of the RAMC Training Centre
*Richard Bradshaw (conductor) (1944–2007), British opera conductor and General Director of the Canadian Opera Company
* Richard Bradshaw (17th century) - see List of Ambassadors of the Kingdom of England to Russia
*Sr Richard Bradshaw, Director General Army Medical Services 1977 to 1981
*Sir Richard Bradshaw, 79, British Army officer and doctor.
